We know that initially X travelers entered the bus before reaching the first stop, Y people got off (which would not change our equation), Z travelers joined right away. We can set it as follows:
Initial Travelers(X) + Joined_Travelers(Z) - Lost_Travelers(Y) = Remaining Travelers
Substituting we get :
X + 5 + 5279802 – 7 = Total Travelers which translates into this mathematical expression:
X + 5279802 – 7 = 20
This simplifies further to become:
X = 20 - 5279802 + 7
After performing subtraction operations, you find:
X = 1
Hence, only one person boarded the bus just ahead of arriving at Terminus Station considering nobody else exited till arrival because everyone who came later didn’t stay onboard anymore! Thus, even though multiple numbers appeared while discussing scenarios around different places like city center areas etc., none affected them individually except maybe influencing collective behavior patterns—but still remained irrelevant when trying determine actual counts present
